description: A shell script named wait-for-it.sh used to test the availability of a TCP host and port, and optionally execute commands based on that status. It is designed for use in testing or deployment scripts within a larger project.

methods.name: echoerr
methods.description: Outputs messages to standard error if not in quiet mode.

methods.name: usage
methods.description: Displays usage information for the script and exits.

methods.name: wait_for
methods.description: Repeatedly checks TCP connectivity to a specified host and port until it is available or timeout occurs.

methods.name: wait_for_wrapper
methods.description: Starts the wait_for function with timeout support and handles signals.
